abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan aims to
            ensure that all project-affected persons are compensated for
            loss of their assets and for temporary difficulties. The
            alignment design of the Inner Ring Road will be modified to
            avoid the densely populated districts or multi-storied
            buildings, and to reduce the affected range of land
            acquisition and demolition. Losses will be compensated with
            replacement costs. Living space will be enlarged, and houses
            constructed with reinforced concrete. Affected shops,
            enterprises, and institutions will maintain (or be restored
            to) their original scale and function, and loses due to
            temporary closures will be compensated. Losses caused by
            land acquisition will be compensated reasonably and paid to
            representative units solely for developing collective
            economic activities. Non-agricultural jobs and pensions will
            be arranged for farmers. So that persons can adapt better to
            resettlement and be self-reliant in a short time, the plan
            will create for them full employment opportunities. Policies
            favoring vulnerable groups such as the elderly living
            independently, widows, single-parents, the disabled, the
            chronically ill, and the poor, will be instituted. Groups
            will be displaced so as to preserve the integrity of the
            original communities. People will be assisted with
            transportation in moving. Resettlement, rehabilitation, and
            compensation will be monitored with PAPs participating in
            the process and a special grievance mechanism set up.
